skill.name: api-designer
skill.description: Design and document RESTful and GraphQL APIs with OpenAPI/Swagger specifications, authentication patterns, versioning strategies, and best practices. Use for: (1) Creating API specifications, (2) Designing REST endpoints, (3) GraphQL schema design, (4) API authentication and authorization, (5) API versioning strategies, (6) Documentation generation
skill.summary: Design and document RESTful and GraphQL APIs with OpenAPI/Swagger specifications, authentication pat...
skill.author: AutumnsGrove

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill providing API design guidance. The only executable code is a Python utility for generating and validating OpenAPI specifications. No network access, no external commands, no credential handling, and no file access beyond user-specified paths.

content.value_statement: Designing APIs from scratch is complex without clear patterns. This skill provides comprehensive guidance for REST and GraphQL API design, including OpenAPI specification generation, authentication flows, and versioning strategies.
actual_capabilities: Design RESTful API endpoints with proper URL structure and HTTP methods
Create GraphQL schemas with types, queries, mutations, and subscriptions
Generate OpenAPI 3.0 specifications for API documentation
Implement OAuth 2.0, JWT, and API key authentication patterns
Plan API versioning strategies with deprecation timelines
Add pagination, filtering, and error handling to APIs
limitations: Does not write or deploy actual API code
Does not test or validate running API endpoints
Does not integrate with API gateways or CI/CD pipelines
Does not generate client SDK code from specifications

use_cases.title: New API development
use_cases.description: Design a new REST API from scratch with proper patterns and OpenAPI documentation

use_cases.title: API standardization
use_cases.description: Establish consistent API patterns and versioning strategies across multiple services

use_cases.title: GraphQL schema design
use_cases.description: Create a GraphQL API schema with proper types, queries, mutations, and subscriptions

prompt_templates.title: Design REST endpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a REST endpoint for [resource] with proper URL structure, HTTP methods, request/response formats, and error handling. Include OpenAPI specification snippet.

prompt_templates.title: Add authentication
prompt_templates.prompt: Add [OAuth 2.0/JWT/API key] authentication to my API specification. Show how to configure the security scheme and protect endpoints.

prompt_templates.title: GraphQL schema
prompt_templates.prompt: Create GraphQL type definitions for [domain] including input types, payload types, and error handling patterns. Include pagination implementation.

prompt_templates.title: API versioning
prompt_templates.prompt: Design an API versioning strategy for transitioning from v1 to v2. Include deprecation headers, migration timeline, and backward compatibility approach.

output_examples.input: Design a users API endpoint for listing and creating users
output: GET /users - List all users with pagination
POST /users - Create new user with validation
Use plural nouns for collections (/users not /user)

best_practices: Use consistent naming conventions: plural nouns, camelCase JSON, ISO 8601 timestamps
Design for backward compatibility: add fields, never remove or change them
Implement proper error handling with consistent error response format across all endpoints
Use pagination (cursor-based recommended) for all collection endpoints
anti_patterns: Using verbs in URLs instead of nouns (getUsers instead of GET /users)
Exposing sensitive data in URLs, logs, or error responses
Making breaking changes without proper versioning and deprecation warnings
Skipping authentication on endpoints that modify data

faq.question: What programming languages work with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill provides language-agnostic API design patterns. Examples use Python and JavaScript syntax, but concepts apply to any language or framework.

faq.question: What are the recommended pagination approaches?
faq.answer: Cursor-based pagination is recommended for real-time data and large datasets. Offset-based pagination works well for small, stable datasets.

faq.question: How does this integrate with my existing API?
faq.answer: Use the provided patterns and OpenAPI specifications as reference. The skill helps you design new endpoints or improve existing API patterns.

faq.question: Is any data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a guidance-only skill. The optional Python script processes files locally without network access or data transmission.

faq.question: Why is my OpenAPI spec failing validation?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing required fields (openapi, info, paths), paths not starting with /, and missing responses for each HTTP method.

faq.question: How is this different from Swagger/OpenAPI tools?
faq.answer: This skill provides design patterns and guidance. Use tools like Swagger Editor or openapi-generator for actual spec editing and code generation.
